definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: They ranted and raved at the injustice of it all.
sentences.chinese: 他们不停的咆哮以抗议这事的不公。

sentences.english: Want to Eradicate Injustice? Go Ahead - The Forward Mail To Everyone You Know …!
sentences.chinese: 你想要根除这些偏见和不公吗？

sentences.english: If you, you will also complain about the unfair fate of it?
sentences.chinese: 如果是你，你还会埋怨命运的不公吗？

sentences.english: In the rebel s universe, death exalts injustice.
sentences.chinese: 在叛逆者的宇宙中，死亡颂扬不公。

sentences.english: I praise the Lord for his unfairness of bestowing such pair of eyes and the lips.
sentences.chinese: 我赞美上帝的不公，他赐予你这样的眉眼和嘴唇。

sentences.english: The authors think that the cause of the current" moral fall" lies in the unfair distribution of interest.
sentences.chinese: 当前道德滑波的原因在于利益的分配不公。

sentences.english: The strictest law sometimes becomes the severest injustice.
sentences.chinese: 最严厉的法律有时会变成最大的不公。

sentences.english: Milne resigned in sympathy because of the way Donald had been treated.
sentences.chinese: 米尔恩以辞职来抗议唐纳德所遭受的不公待遇。

sentences.english: Britain’s Office of Fair Trading has already ruled some bank charges unfair.
sentences.chinese: 英国的公平交易委员会，已经判定某些银行交易不公。

sentences.english: That not all have benefited is another reason to argue over taxes.
sentences.chinese: 而利益分配不公是导致税收争论的又一个原因。

sentences.english: Court on the racial discrimination and injustice such as the Cameron stuck in throat.
sentences.chinese: 法庭上的种族歧视和不公令卡梅隆如鲠在喉。

sentences.english: A business offering true honest service might be unfairly hurt.
sentences.chinese: 提供真诚服务的商店会不公平地受损。

sentences.english: Even if death were inevitable, it wouldn't have to come in different-sized packages.
sentences.chinese: 就算死亡是不可避免的，它也不一定要年龄分配不公。

sentences.english: Protesters are raising questions about the rich-poor divide and miscarriage of justice.
sentences.chinese: 抗议者提出了贫富分化和审判不公等问题。

sentences.english: The unbalanced nature of the game reduces its replayability.
sentences.chinese: 游戏的不公平性降低了其反复可玩性。

sentences.english: In the rebels universe, death exalts injustice.
sentences.chinese: 在叛逆者的宇宙中，死亡颂扬不公。

definition: (idiom) to blame the gods and accuse others
to complain/to grumble/to harbor a complaint/to feel dissatisfied
variant of 憤憤不平|愤愤不平[fen4 fen4 bu4 ping2]
to cry out against injustice/to protest unfairness
